H0.text: Neurons are the cells that form the basis of nervous tissue.

H1.text: Erythrocytes are the cells that are the basis of nervous tissue.

H2.text: Lipocytes are the cells that form the basis of nervous tissue.

H3.text: Osteoclasts are not the cells that form the basis of nervous tissue.

A4.text: Neurons are the primary components of the nervous system, along with the glial cells that give them structural and metabolic support.

A5.text: The neuron doctrine is the now fundamental idea that neurons are the basic structural and functional units of the nervous system.
